| Section3 = {{Chembox Hazards Solubility = MainHazards = FlashPt =
| Autoignition =
  }} }} 'Ribose 5-phosphate' is both a product and an intermediate of the
  pentose phosphate pathway. The last step of the oxidative reactions in the
  pentose phosphate pathway is the production of ribulose-5-phosphate. Depending
  on the body's state, ribulose-5-phosphate can reversibly isomerize to ribose-5-
  phosphate. Ribulose-5-phosphate can alternatively undergo a series of
  isomerizations as well as transaldolations and transketolations that result in
  the production of other pentoses phosphates as well as fructose 6-phosphate
  and glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate (both intermediates in glycolysis).

The enzyme ribose-phosphate diphosphokinase converts ribose-5-phosphate into
phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate.
